result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Pearson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy Pearson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Timothy Pearson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy Pearson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Timothy Pearson.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel needs an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders  bail to be returned to the person who posted.  
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SMY.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Timothy Pearson in court.     Abigail Doweiko, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 29.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-8-2022 @1p
